page.title: 06Transport-Broughton/Holt
page.content: Public transport in this area is generally very sparse and is non-existant in the evening and on Sunday. A bus service runs between Chippenham, Melksham and Trowbridge passing through the villages every 2 hours Monday-Saturday, this service ends at 5.30pm. On Wedsnesday and Saturday there is a morning service to Bath, giving three hours shopping before returning at lunch time. This shopping bus is well used as the fare is reasonable. The regular service taking passengers to the local towns is little used except early morning and evening when people travel to and from work and school. A high percentage of households have their own cars and cycles. The nearest mainline railway station is at Chippenham eight miles away.
